Zzzzz.  Didn't we just do that?

And in season 3......It is literally the same every year except it starts on different steps some times. This game is, in the grand scheme of things, a very big game of rock paper scissors with like 5 different options instead of 3 which all cycle back to each other. The only problem with the current iteration of League's rock-paper-scissors is that it is Tank<Marksman<Assassin<Fighter<Marksman/Control Mage<Assassin<FIghter<Marksman/Control Mage<etc.

Notice anything strange? Tanks are nowhere to be found because Riot has currently made them sub-optimal to bring when compared to a Juggernaut that is arguably just as bulky but packs a lot more damage for the sacrifice of CC (To an extent since Death is arguably the hardest form of CC since it stuns you for 30+ seconds AND teleports you to the fountain. This is only surpassed by the duration of Morgana Binding where she disconnects you from the game entirely). Tanks, yes do well against Assassins, but Fighters also do well against Assassins while also doing well against Tanks which completely removes them from the equation.
And he can now hit 100% crit chance with his standard 2 items (Shiv and I-Edge).
And of course there is now a sustain-on-crit mastery.

It will be so hard to play Pantheon well this season... You have like 8 offensives items which all look great on him as well as 2-3 offensive keystone masteries, but you will actually have to build tanky to be useful.

So basically, the different between a good Pantheon and a great Pantheon in S6 is that the great Pantheon is able to stop buying AD items.
I think the new essence reaver and trinity force plus an armor pen item will be all the offense he needs. 3 slots for tanky gear left.

ER + Youmu's is once choice, Maw + Hydra is another (Maw is really strong, and you can get ravenous early and later change to titanic for free), Triforce + Death's Dance is definitely possible...
